events.name: IoT Solutions with Google Android Things
events.description:
IoT Solutions with Google Android Things This talk will be about Android Things OS for IoT solutions and about interfaces for using new devices in particular Google Assistant as voice interface. 



SPEAKER1: Denis Nek  


Google Developer Expert who live together with Android for more than six years. He is also well-known as co-host of famous Russian speaking Android development podcast. Now he’s working in Singapore at 90Seconds.tv. Deeply interested in IoT solutions have experience creating his own prototypes with Raspberry Pi and Arduino.  SPEAKER2: Bharathi Subramanian  


Bharathi is Principal consultant at Auctorizium Pte Ltd. He is working on Electronic Travel Document Security and Crypto Library Development. He is the core-team member of Google Developer Group - Singapore. Apart from Crypto, Bharathi worked on number of Embedded Linux and Android System Projects in Telecom, Network and Consumer electronics fields. ************************************************************  DATE & AGENDA: Thursday, 6th July  2017 • 06:30 pm – Registration/ Networking • 06:50 pm – Introduction by CK • 07:00 pm – Talk & Demo by Denis Nek • •07:45 pm – Talk & Demo by Bharathi • 08:15 pm –  QnA  • 08:30 pm - Networking continued ************************************************************  VENUE SPONSOR LEVEL3 20 Pasir Panjang Road (East Wing) Mapletree Business City #03-22 Singapore[masked]  ************************************************************  Note: Please note that photography and videography will be carried out throughout the event.  IoT SG, Event Sponsors, Supporters may use some or all of these images in its print publications, digital, social platforms and/or marketing channels. We also ask some personal information and questions during registration. This data is used to do further due diligence to improve the quality of events. This data may also be shared with sponsoring organisations, speakers to help them to collaborate more efficiently. We do not sell your data
events.location: LEVEL3, Mapletree Business City #03-22, 20 Pasir Panjang Road (East Wing), Singapore

events.name: PyTorch Singapore: First Meeting
events.description: Due to Facebook's building security, attendees need to give their First name, Family name (which should match your ID) and Email to get into the Facebook offices... PLEASE NOTE: this event is geared more to people who are familiar with Deep Learning already and who are using (or are wondering about using) PyTorch for doing Deep Learning.  If you are new to Deep Learning then this is probably not the right MeetUp for you. Since it is the first event we will begin by going through a crash course of how things work in the PyTorch syntax for building models and how it differs from other frameworks out there.  We aim to highlight some of the advantages of using PyTorch for research and prototyping models (and some of the gotchas). We are currently looking for people to give talks : Both researchers & Deep Learning enthusiasts who are using PyTorch and people who would like to present something Deep Learning-related (any framework) are encouraged to speak.
events.location: Facebook APAC, 38 Beach Road, South Beach Tower, 189673, Singapore

events.name: July 2017 Meetup
events.description: We skipped a month, but we are back in July and we have some super cool topics lined up. Big thanks to Zendesk for hosting us once again! Agenda:7pm: Meet & GreetWhile everyone arrives, we have the chance to chat and mingle, Zendesk is kindly sponsoring snacks and soft-drinks. 7:30pm: Talk #1: Deep Learning with Python in Finance by Ben Ball Abstract: Python is becoming the de facto standard for many machine learning applications. We have been using Python with deep learning and other ML techniques, with a focus in prediction and exploitation in transactional markets. I am presenting one of our implementations (A dueling double DQN - a class of Reinforcement Learning algorithm) in Python using TensorFlow, along with information and background around the class of deep learning algorithm, and the application to financial markets we have employed. Attendees will learn how to implement a DQN using Tensorflow, and how to design a system for deep learning for solving a wide range of problems. The code will be available on github for attendees. Bio: Ben is a believer in making a career out of what you love. He is inspired by the joining of excellent technology and research and likes building software that is easy to use, but does amazing things. His work has spanned 15 years, with a dual focus in AI Software Engineering and Algorithmic Trading. He is currently working as the CTO of http://prediction-machines.com  8pm: Talk #2: Introduction to MicroPython - Mighty Python Running on Tiny Embedded Boards by Ovidiu HossuAbstract: Coming soon! Hardware-hackers listen up! Ovidiu will give an introduction to MicroPython and bring a few of his boards to run some real-world demos. 8:30pm: Open AnnouncementsIf you have anything to share with the community, just grab the mic and spread the word :) ======================================= About Zendesk:  Zendesk builds software for better customer relationships. It empowers organizations to improve customer engagement and better understand their customers. Zendesk products are easy to use and implement. They give organizations the exibility to move quickly, focus on innovation, and scale with their growth.
events.location: Zendesk @ Haw Par Techno Centre, 401 Commonwealth Drive, #07-01, Singapore

events.name: July Meetup
events.description:
Hi friends! We're thrilled to have a Serverless Singapore meetup in July.  


Programme  7.00pm: Doors open - mingle over food and drinks 7.20pm: Start of session, opening address by hosts 7.30pm: Start of scheduled talks 9:00pm: Community announcements / End of event  Scheduled Talks  • 'Building Scalable Applications with the Serverless Framework and AWS Lambda' by Yos Riady • 'Building Hybrid Serverless Architecture: Amazon ECS and AWS Lambda using Serverless Framework' by Adrien Desbiaux 


Information for Attendees Remember to bring a photo ID to get through building security! The meetup will be held at AWS Singapore, 23 Church Street, Capital Square #10-01. If you're traveling by MRT, the closest MRT station is DT18 Telok Ayer.  Sponsor
events.location: AWS Offices Singapore, 23 Church Street, Capital Square #10-01, 049481 Singapore
